result.execSummary:
The defendant Raul G Galvan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 8/01/2016 or penalty of 2 days consecutive to any sentence.
Huber with standard release conditions (including family care).  Sentence credit for 8 days were granted.  Defendant to report to Huber Facility by Monday 6/13/2016 at noon.

records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Received July 29, 2016, Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Graber

Defendant Raul G Galvan in court with attorney Katherine Jean Graber.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Graber makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Sentence of:
15 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS including family care.  (Credit - 8 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by Monday 6/13/2016 at Noon.  
COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 a month commencing 8/1/2016, failure to pay will result in 2 day huber, consecutive. 
NO DNA SAMPLE OR SURCHARGE
